_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

How a mendicant lives life so as to not: Take a mendicant who relishes work
Take a mendicant who relishes talk
Take a mendicant who relishes sleep
Take a mendicant who relishes company
Take a mendicant who relishes closeness
Take a mendicant who relishes proliferation
How a mendicant lives life so as to have: Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish work
Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish talk
Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish sleep
Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish company
Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish closeness
Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish proliferation
The two types of mendicants (a causal se: A mendicant who enjoys identity, who hasn’t given up identity to rightly make an end of suffering
A mendicant who delights in extinguishment, who has given up identity to rightly make an end of suffering
The two types of beasts [an6.14:7.4]: A beast who likes to proliferate, enjoying proliferation, fails to win extinguishment, the supreme sanctuary
One who gives up proliferation, enjoying the state of non-proliferation, wins extinguishment, the supreme sanctuary
